q: Simon Cowell has made his mark "by going against the grain and having the courage to say exactly what is on his mind. " "I'm not a master of anything," says Simon Cowell . I think what I'm good at is making shows or records which a lot of people will like for the same reasons I like them. He says he truly trusts his own instincts and when evaluating talent, doesn"t necessarily think of himself as a person running a record company or in charge of a TV show. "

in a 2003 national security meeting when he was told that Saddam Hussein was offering a$ 60 million bounty to kill Donald Rumsfeld 's daughters. "I was concerned," Donald Rumsfeld told ABC News on Tuesday. Of course the president and his family had secret service protection. My family did not. The plot also targeted President Bush 's two daughters, Donald Rumsfeld said, and President Bush urged him to take it seriously because the administration had killed Saddam Hussein 's sons.
